tit.e: Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) (a rank in Japan)
Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) (a rank in Japan)
Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) (a rank in Japan)

sen.j: 従五位（じゅごい）とは、日本の位階及び神階における位のひとつ。
sen.e: The term "Jugoi" (Junior Fifth Rank) refers to an Ikai (court rank) or a Shinkai (ranks granted to Shinto gods) in Japan.
The term "Jugoi" (Junior Fifth Rank) refers to an Ikai (court rank) or a Shinkai (ranks granted to Shinto gods) in Japan.
The term "Jugoi" (Junior Fifth Rank) refers to an Ikai (court rank) or a Shinkai (ranks granted to Shinto gods) in Japan.

sen.j: 正五位の下、正六位の上に位する。
sen.e: It ranks below Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank), above Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank).
It ranks below Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank), above Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank).
It ranks below Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank), above Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank).

sen.j: 贈位の場合、贈従五位という。
sen.e: If it was conferred posthumously, it is referred to as Zo Jugoi (Jugoi conferred posthumously).
sen.cmt: 贈位: terms欄の訳語を、文構造に合わせて修正しています。/贈従五位: カッコ内の説明は定訳ではありません。
sen.e: If it was conferred posthumously, it is referred to as Zo Jugoi (Jugoi conferred posthumously).
If it was conferred posthumously, it is referred to as Zo Jugoi (Jugoi conferred posthumously).

sen.j: 近代以前の日本における位階制度では、従五位下以上の位階を持つ者が貴族とされている。
sen.e: Those who belonged to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) or a higher rank were regarded as nobles in the Japanese court rank system before the Meiji period.
Those who belonged to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) or a higher rank were regarded as nobles in the Japanese court rank system before the Meiji period.
Those who belonged to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) or a higher rank were regarded as nobles in the Japanese court rank system before the Meiji period.

sen.j: また、華族の嫡男が従五位に叙せられる。
sen.e: Jugoi was conferred on an eldest legitimate son of the peerage.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Jugoi was conferred on an eldest legitimate son of the peerage.
Jugoi was conferred on an eldest legitimate son of the peerage.

sen.j: (その)ことから、華族の嫡男の異称としても用いられた。
sen.e: Therefore, it was also used as a different name for an eldest legitimate son of the peerage.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になったため、カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)
sen.e: Therefore, it was also used as a different name for an eldest legitimate son of the peerage.
Therefore, it was also used as a different name for an eldest legitimate son of the peerage.

tit.e: Before and in the Edo period
tit.cmt: 江戸時代も含まれるため、「before and in」と訳しています。
tit.e: Before and in the Edo period
Before and in the Edo period

sen.j: 律令制下において五位は国司や鎮守府将軍、諸大夫に相当する位であった。
sen.e: Goi (Fifth Rank) was a rank corresponding to Kokushi (provincial governor), Chinjufu shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North) and Shodaibu (aristocracy lower than Kugyo) in the ritsuryo system.
sen.cmt: 鎮守府将軍: 用語統一リストに従い、terms欄の訳語からハイフンを削除しました。
sen.e: Goi (Fifth Rank) was a rank corresponding to Kokushi (provincial governor), Chinjufu shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North) and Shodaibu (aristocracy lower than Kugyo) in the ritsuryo system.

Goi (Fifth Rank) was a rank corresponding to Kokushi (provincial governor), Chinjufu shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North) and Shodaibu (aristocracy lower than Kugyo) in the ritsuryo system.

sen.j: さらに、従五位下以上の位階にある者を「通貴」、従三位以上の者を「貴」とされた。
sen.e: Those who belonged to Jugoinoge or a higher rank were called 'Tsuki' (通貴), and those who belonged to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) or a higher rank were called 'Ki' (貴).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処後列の訳文を理解させるためには「通貴」「貴」の漢字表記が必要なため、これらを表記しています。
sen.e: Those who belonged to Jugoinoge or a higher rank were called 'Tsuki' (通貴), and those who belonged to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) or a higher rank were called 'Ki' (貴).
Those who belonged to Jugoinoge or a higher rank were called 'Tsuki' (通貴), and those who belonged to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) or a higher rank were called 'Ki' (貴).

sen.j: (その)ことから、五位以上がいわゆる貴族の位階とされた。
sen.e: For this reason, Goi (Fifth Rank) and higher ranks were regarded as ranks for so-called Kizoku (nobles) written in kanji (Chinese characters) "貴族" (The first kanji "貴" meaning "nobility" was also used in the above-mentioned terms "Tsuki" [通貴] and "Ki" [貴].).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になったため、カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)
sen.e: For this reason, Goi (Fifth Rank) and higher ranks were regarded as ranks for so-called Kizoku (nobles) written in kanji (Chinese characters) "貴族" (The first kanji "貴" meaning "nobility" was also used in the above-mentioned terms "Tsuki" [通貴] and "Ki" [貴].).

For this reason, Goi (Fifth Rank) and higher ranks were regarded as ranks for so-called Kizoku (nobles) written in kanji (Chinese characters) "貴族" (The first kanji "貴" meaning "nobility" was also used in the above-mentioned terms "Tsuki" [通貴] and "Ki" [貴].).

sen.j: 五位は正従、上下にわけられた。
sen.e: Goi was divided into senior and junior subdivisions, each of which was further divided into upper and lower grades.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Goi was divided into senior and junior subdivisions, each of which was further divided into upper and lower grades.
Goi was divided into senior and junior subdivisions, each of which was further divided into upper and lower grades.

sen.j: 正五位上から従五位下に分けられた。
sen.e: Accordingly, Goi ranged from Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/「range」を使うと、「from 最下位 to 最上位」となるため、その順序で訳しています。
sen.e: Accordingly, Goi ranged from Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
Accordingly, Goi ranged from Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: (その)ことから、従五位下以上の位階にあることが平安貴族としての資格であったといえる。
sen.e: Thus it may be said that it was necessary for nobles in the Heian period to belong to Jugoinoge or a higher rank.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になったため、カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)/資格: terms欄の訳語は文脈に合わないため、別の訳出をしています。
sen.e: Thus it may be said that it was necessary for nobles in the Heian period to belong to Jugoinoge or a higher rank.
Thus it may be said that it was necessary for nobles in the Heian period to belong to Jugoinoge or a higher rank.

sen.j: この従五位下の別称を栄爵と別称し、またその位階にある者を大夫といった。
sen.e: While another name of Jugoinoge was Eishaku (the title of honorable position or honorable noble class), those who belonged to this rank were referred to as Daibu (Master).
While another name of Jugoinoge was Eishaku (the title of honorable position or honorable noble class), those who belonged to this rank were referred to as Daibu (Master).
While another name of Jugoinoge was Eishaku (the title of honorable position or honorable noble class), those who belonged to this rank were referred to as Daibu (Master).

sen.j: また、中国では秦の始皇帝がマツの木に日本の従五位に相当する大夫の位を授けた。
sen.e: The first Qin Emperor in China conferred the rank of Daibu, which corresponded to Jugoi in Japan, on a pine tree.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The first Qin Emperor in China conferred the rank of Daibu, which corresponded to Jugoi in Japan, on a pine tree.
The first Qin Emperor in China conferred the rank of Daibu, which corresponded to Jugoi in Japan, on a pine tree.

sen.j: (その)ことから、大夫に相当する従五位を松爵（しょうしゃく）とも別称するようになった。
sen.e: For this reason, Jugoi corresponding to Daibu was also referred to as Shoshaku (松爵) (literally, "peerage of a pine tree").
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になったため、カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)
sen.e: For this reason, Jugoi corresponding to Daibu was also referred to as Shoshaku (松爵) (literally, "peerage of a pine tree").
For this reason, Jugoi corresponding to Daibu was also referred to as Shoshaku (松爵) (literally, "peerage of a pine tree").

sen.j: これらのことから、従五位下に叙せられることを叙爵といった。
sen.e: Therefore, conferring Jugoinoge was referred to as Joshaku (conferring a peerage).
Therefore, conferring Jugoinoge was referred to as Joshaku (conferring a peerage).
Therefore, conferring Jugoinoge was referred to as Joshaku (conferring a peerage).

sen.j: この従五位下にあった主な者としては、代々、国司を務めた藤原氏の傍流や橘氏、高階氏などの一門、清和源氏、桓武平氏などの軍事貴族。
sen.e: Those who belonged to Jugoinoge were mainly members of branches of the Fujiwara clan who served as Kokushi for generations, members of the Tachibana, Takashina and other clans, members of Seiwa Genji (Minamoto clan) and Kanmu Heishi (Taira clan) that belonged to the military aristocracy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/清和源氏、桓武平氏: 用語統一リストに従い、terms欄または用語集の訳語のハイフンを削除しました。
sen.e: Those who belonged to Jugoinoge were mainly members of branches of the Fujiwara clan who served as Kokushi for generations, members of the Tachibana, Takashina and other clans, members of Seiwa Genji (Minamoto clan) and Kanmu Heishi (Taira clan) that belonged to the military aristocracy.

Those who belonged to Jugoinoge were mainly members of branches of the Fujiwara clan who served as Kokushi for generations, members of the Tachibana, Takashina and other clans, members of Seiwa Genji (Minamoto clan) and Kanmu Heishi (Taira clan) that belonged to the military aristocracy.

sen.j: (それらのもの)に至るまで中級貴族層の多くがこの位に叙せられた。
sen.e: This rank was conferred on many middle-class nobles including the above-mentioned clan members.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になったため、カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)/中級貴族: terms欄の訳語はGoogle検索で1件もヒットしないため、ヒット件数が多いフレーズに修正しています。
sen.e: This rank was conferred on many middle-class nobles including the above-mentioned clan members.
This rank was conferred on many middle-class nobles including the above-mentioned clan members.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代初期までは、京都の中級下級貴族と、鎌倉幕府において京都下りの吏僚、或いは源氏一門、有力な名門御家人などがこの位にあった。
sen.e: This rank was conferred on nobles of the middle and lower ranks in Kyoto, riryo (government official) who went to Kyoto under the regime of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), members of the Minamoto clan, influential gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) from a family of pedigree until the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 下級貴族: terms欄の用語は文構造に合わないため、文脈に合わせて修正しています。
sen.e: This rank was conferred on nobles of the middle and lower ranks in Kyoto, riryo (government official) who went to Kyoto under the regime of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), members of the Minamoto clan, and influential gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) from a family of pedigree, until the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: influential gokeninの前にand、untilの前にカンマ(,)を挿入
sen.e: This rank was conferred on nobles of the middle and lower ranks in Kyoto, riryo (government official) who went to Kyoto under the regime of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), members of the Minamoto clan, and influential gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) from a family of pedigree, until the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 室町時代には、足利将軍家や守護の初叙位階でもあった。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, it was also an Ikai conferred on members of Ashikaga Shogun Family or Shugo (provincial constable) for the first time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/初叙: terms欄の訳語を、文構造に合わせて修正しています。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, it was also an Ikai conferred on members of Ashikaga Shogun Family or Shugo (provincial constable) as the first investiture.
sen.cmt: for the first time --> as the first investiture
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, it was also an Ikai conferred on members of Ashikaga Shogun Family or Shugo (provincial constable) as the first investiture.

sen.j: 守護や有力国人なども多くがこの位にあった。
sen.e: This rank was also conferred on many Shugo, powerful Kokujin (local samurai) and others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This rank was also conferred on many Shugo, powerful Kokujin (local samurai) and others.
This rank was also conferred on many Shugo, powerful Kokujin (local samurai) and others.

sen.j: 江戸時代以降は、御家門のうち傍流にして知行の少ない家、譜代大名、10万石に満たない外様大名は、或いは大身の旗本はみな従五位下に叙せられた。
sen.e: Jugoinoge was conferred on all branches that came from the lineage of a prestigious family and had few enfeoffment, all fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family), all tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) having Kokudaka (assessed yield) under 100,000 Koku (approximately 18 million liters of crop yield) in their territory, and all hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) of high rank in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/江戸時代以降: 文の内容は江戸時代だけに関わることであり、それ以降(明治以降)には当てはまりません(筆者は「江戸時代初期以降」と記載したかったのかもしれません)。そのため、英文が矛盾しないように「in the Edo period」と訳しています。/旗本: terms欄の「bakufu」の説明は、これより前に記載済ですので、省略しました。
sen.e: Jugoinoge was conferred on all branches that came from the lineage of a prestigious family and had few enfeoffments, all fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family), all tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) having Kokudaka (assessed yield) under 100,000 Koku (approximately 18 million liters of crop yield) in their territory, and all hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) of high rank in the Edo period.

Jugoinoge was conferred on all branches that came from the lineage of a prestigious family and had few enfeoffments, all fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family), all tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) having Kokudaka (assessed yield) under 100,000 Koku (approximately 18 million liters of crop yield) in their territory, and all hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) of high rank in the Edo period.

sen.j: 主に大名・有力旗本、ないし御三家・御三卿及び家門筆頭の福井藩の家老及び加賀藩の家老本多氏、長州藩の支族吉川氏が岩国藩として立藩を認められた際に叙せられた。
sen.e: It was conferred mainly on daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), powerful hatamoto, gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa Family), gosankyo (three branches of Tokugawa family, which was established by the eighth shogun Yoshimune TOKUGAWA), the Honda clan serving as Karo (chief retainer) of the Fukui Domain ruled by Tokugawa's relatives of the highest rank or the Kaga Domain, and the Kikkawa clan, a branch family of the Choshu clan, at the time when the Kikkawa clan was allowed to found the Iwakuni Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/御三家・御三卿: 「御三家」は、ここでは「徳川御三家」を意味するため、カッコ内の説明は「徳川御三家」として登録されている説明を用いています。また、terms欄の訳語では両者の区別がつかないため、、「御三卿」は「http://www.museumstuff.com/learn/topics/Gosankyo」「http://kotobank.jp/word/%E4%B8%89%E5%8D%BF」を基に、修正しています(これは定訳ではありません)/家門筆頭: 徳川御家門筆頭(親藩)(http://echizenke.web.fc2.com/)を意味するため、「親藩」として登録されている訳語を参考にして訳しています。/福井藩の家老及び加賀藩の家老本多氏: 「福井藩の家老」「加賀藩の家老」は両方とも「本多氏」に係るため(参考: http://spysee.jp/%E6%9C%AC%E5%A4%9A%E5%89%AF%E5%85%83/66364/)、その意味で訳しています。/長州藩: ここでは人の集団を指すため、「clan」と訳しています。
sen.e: It was conferred mainly on daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), powerful hatamoto, gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa Family), gosankyo (three branches of Tokugawa family, which was established by the eighth shogun Yoshimune TOKUGAWA), the Honda clan serving as Karo (chief retainer) of the Fukui Domain ruled by Tokugawa's relatives of the highest rank or the Kaga Domain, and the Kikkawa clan, a branch family of the Choshu clan, at the time when the Kikkawa clan was allowed to found the Iwakuni Domain.

It was conferred mainly on daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), powerful hatamoto, gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa Family), gosankyo (three branches of Tokugawa family, which was established by the eighth shogun Yoshimune TOKUGAWA), the Honda clan serving as Karo (chief retainer) of the Fukui Domain ruled by Tokugawa's relatives of the highest rank or the Kaga Domain, and the Kikkawa clan, a branch family of the Choshu clan, at the time when the Kikkawa clan was allowed to found the Iwakuni Domain.

sen.j: 特に加賀藩の本多氏は位階のみの散位であった。
sen.e: Although the court rank of Jugoi was conferred on the Honda clan from the Kaga Domain, the corresponding post was not given to it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/散位: 「位階だけで官職のないこと」(http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%95%A3%E4%BD%8D)という意味なので、その意味で訳しています。
sen.e: Although the court rank of Jugoi was conferred on the Honda clan from the Kaga Domain, the corresponding post was not given to it.
Although the court rank of Jugoi was conferred on the Honda clan from the Kaga Domain, the corresponding post was not given to it.

sen.j: (その)ため、「従五位様」、「従五位殿」と他称された。
sen.e: Therefore, members of the clan were called 'Jugoi sama' or 'Jugoi dono' (Both terms mean literally "Mr. Jugoi.").
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になったため、カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)
sen.e: Therefore, members of the clan were called 'Jugoi sama' or 'Jugoi dono' (Both terms mean literally "Mr. Jugoi.").
Therefore, members of the clan were called 'Jugoi sama' or 'Jugoi dono' (Both terms mean literally "Mr. Jugoi.").

tit.e: In and after the Meiji period
tit.cmt: 明治時代も含まれるため、「in and after」と訳しています。
tit.e: In and after the Meiji period
In and after the Meiji period

sen.j: 明治時代以降、華族の嫡男は自動的に従五位に叙せられた。
sen.e: Jugoi had been automatically conferred on an eldest legitimate son of the peerage since the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Jugoi had been automatically conferred on an eldest legitimate son of the peerage since the Meiji period.
Jugoi had been automatically conferred on an eldest legitimate son of the peerage since the Meiji period.

sen.j: (その)ことから、華族の嫡男の異称を従五位ともいう。
sen.e: For this reason, an eldest legitimate son of the peerage was also referred to as Jugoi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になったため、カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)/異称: terms欄の訳語は文脈に合わないため、別の訳出をしています。
sen.e: For this reason, an eldest legitimate son of the peerage was also referred to as Jugoi.
For this reason, an eldest legitimate son of the peerage was also referred to as Jugoi.

sen.j: 中佐の階級にある者などもこの位に叙せられた。
sen.e: This rank was also conferred on Lieutenant Colonels and others.
sen.cmt: 中佐: 「陸軍中佐」として用語集に登録されている訳語および、英辞郎 on the Webを基に訳しています。
sen.e: This rank was also conferred on Lieutenant Colonels and others.
This rank was also conferred on Lieutenant Colonels and others.

sen.j: 現在では、死没者に対する栄典として与えられることとなっている。
sen.e: At present, it is to be conferred on the deceased as a mark of honor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At present, it is to be conferred on the deceased as a mark of honor.
At present, it is to be conferred on the deceased as a mark of honor.

sen.j: 都道府県議会議長経験者、学校長や警察署長、消防署長、消防団長、企業の社長として功を為した人に対して叙位が行われている。
sen.e: It is conferred on the deceased who rendered distinguished service as chairperson of a prefectural assembly, head of a school, chief of police, fire chief, chief of a fire company or president of a company.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/都道府県議会: terms欄の「都道府県」の訳語は文構造に合わないので、新和英中辞典第４版（研究社）の「議会(県議会)」の訳語を使用しています。/消防団長: 定訳不明/叙位: terms欄の訳語は文構造に合わないので、文脈に合わせて修正しています。
sen.e: It is conferred on the deceased who rendered distinguished service as chairperson of a prefectural assembly, head of a school, chief of police, fire chief, chief of a fire company or president of a company.

It is conferred on the deceased who rendered distinguished service as chairperson of a prefectural assembly, head of a school, chief of police, fire chief, chief of a fire company or president of a company.
